Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2010 08:06AM hopeful01 wrote: MBCR-was it a difficult decision to choose the lumpectomy over mastectomy?  My mom and 2 cousins had cancer and I feel like if I get rid of the whole breast I won't ever have to worry about it.  Did you have similar thoughts?
Posts.Title: The Waiting is the Worst... hopeful01 MBCR

Posts.Content: hopeful01 wrote: Like most of you in this particular forum, I too am waiting for results to come back from a biopsy.  The waiting is killing me!  I had a yearly mammo, got a call that they want to re-do because they found something on the right breast, they re-did the mammo and also did an ultrasound, met with breast doc (not sure exactly of her title) she showed me the ultrasound and pointed out an area that they were concerned about.  I then had a biopsy yesterday and the radiologist that did the test tried to extract fluid but said it had blood in it so she changed to a vacuum biopsy.  She said she got most of it that she could see and would send to pathology and the doctor would call me.  In the meantime my boob hurts and I'm scared! I have been reading on this forum about the percentages of actually having a malignancy but for some reason that doesn't help me!  Also, is it normal to "tag" the spot?  What exactly does that mean?    Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: The Waiting is the Worst... hopeful01 MBCR

Posts.Content: Jan 31, 2010 08:03AM hopeful01 wrote: Artsymom - I was told 5 business days to wait for results.  I think the type of biopsy they do depends on how big the lump or mass is, but I could be wrong.  I am trying to be positive and tell myself that it is more than likely benign and if it is not there are so many options for treatment.  The survival rate is excellent!  I was trying to think of the worst possible scenario and the worst doesn't seem so bad - it's not a death sentence just a bump in the road, right?
Posts.Title: The Waiting is the Worst... hopeful01 MBCR

Posts.Content: hopeful01 wrote: Hello - When you were diagnosed was a lump ever found?  I have been reading on this board that most IBC does not present with a lump but that other types of breast cancers do.  Thank you for your responses. Log in to post a reply
